Detailed Description

template<class T>
class SlimVector< T >

SlimVector is a template class to manage a vector of something.

Something could be a class, a struct or a basic type as int, long, char *, etc.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class T>
SlimVector< T >::~SlimVector (   )  [inline]
 

Destroy the vector and all the items stored in it.

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
void SlimVector< T >::beginSequentialReading (  void   )  [inline]
 

Begin a sequential reading of the vector. This function only set an internal reading cursor just before the first item stored in the vector. Calling next readItem() or eraseItemAtReadingCursor() will, respectively, get a reference on the first item in the vector or remove and destroy it.

See also:
readItem()

eraseItemAtReadingCursor()

template<class T>

Remove and destroy all the items stored in vector

void SlimVector< T >::erase (  unsigned int  x  )  [inline]
 

Remove from vector the object at position x and destroy it.

Parameters:
x the position of the object to remove and destroy

template<class T>
void SlimVector< T >::eraseItemAtReadingCursor (  void   )  [inline]
 

Erase the item pointed by internal reading cursor. This cursor is set when vector is traversed by mean of beginSequentialReading() and readItem() functions. If internal reading cursor is NULL, eraseItemAtReadingCursor() will remove and destroy the last item. After removing, internal reading cursor is set on the previous item. As a consequence, the next call to readItem() will get a pointer on the "ex-"following item of the removed one. But the next call to eraseItemAtReadingCursor() will remove the "ex-"previous item of the removed one. If vector is empty, eraseItemAtReadingCursor() will return without doing anything.

See also:
beginSequentialReading()

readItem()

template<class T>
T SlimVector< T >::getLastItem (  void   )  [inline]
 

Retrieve a copy of the last item in the vector. This function must not be call if vector is empty.

Returns:
an instance of class T

Retrieve a reference on the item stored at position x

Parameters:
x position of the item to get a reference on.
Returns:
a pointer on a instance of class T or NULL if x is greater than the number of items in vector

template<class T>
bool SlimVector< T >::isEndOfVector (  void   )  [inline]
 

Test if the reading cursor is after the last item of the vector

Returns:

template<class T>
T SlimVector< T >::operator[] (  unsigned int  x  )  const [inline]
 

Retrieve a copy of the item stored at position x. vector[0] retrieve a copy of first item, vector[1] retrieve a copy of second item, etc.

Parameters:
x position of the item to get a copy of. x must be lower than the number of items in vector.
Returns:
an instance of class T

template<class T>
T SlimVector< T >::pop (  void   )  [inline]
 

Get a copy of the last object previously added in vector. If vector is empty, a SLIMVECTOR_ENDOFVECTOR error code will be returned in lastError.

Returns:
a copy of the last object added in vector.

template<class T>
T SlimVector< T >::readItem (  void   )  [inline]
 

Make internal reading cursor going one item forward, and retrieve the newly current item.

Returns:
an instance of class T, or NULL if the end of the vector is reached.

Make internal reading cursor going one item forward, and retrieve a reference on the newly current item.

Returns:
